item.title: Data Scientist
item.description:
• Data Scientist

      Toronto, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Waterloo King
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        Role Summary

        Within Sun Life Canada, the Canadian Analytics Centre of Excellence (COE) was launched to support Canadian business units in their journey to leverage data and analytics as a foundational pillar in delivering business value.

        Reporting to the Director, Data Science as a Data Scientist you will focus on supporting Canadian business units in accelerating the growth and application of analytics in driving value.  The data scientist will leverage practical experience in applying varied data science techniques & offering inputs to help with the design, development and implementation of analytics use cases.

        Sun Life views success in this role in demonstration of these key attributes:

        Fierce curiosity. You are drawn to discovering and leveraging new data and taking on challenging business puzzles. An inquisitive mind. Driven to ask questions to help lead projects to commercial value and not being afraid that the innovation attempts can and will lead to failing. A passion for solving problems.  The most successful data scientists’ solution for what the right data to use, they solve using the most suitable (not most advanced) algorithms for the problem at hand and figure out how to execute and deliver with highest efficiency. Technical skills in both data and computer science.

        What will you do?

        • Apply best in breed data science including descriptive, predictive, machine learning, deep learning and AI techniques from the design to implementation that impacts the business.

        • Focus on Feature Engineering, Model Training and Model Evaluation in addition to data munging / wrangling

        • Identify the right algorithms and statistical techniques for a specific project as well as the best features for a model.  Advise junior members on the same.

        • Assist in make business recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders

        • An active contributing member to the analytics community to help foster and grow the data science community at Sun Life

        What will you need to succeed?

        • BSc/M.S. in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science) or equivalent experience

        • Minimum of 1 year experience in developing and implementing data science techniques (predictive, prescriptive, ML etc.)

        • Comfortable writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources

        • Proficient in using one or more statistical programming languages (i.e., Python) for data science

        • Big Data Technologies: Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, Kafka

        • Experience with deep learning methodologies either in practice or in academia

        • Effective and concise oral and written storytelling and insights communication skills

        • Ability to work on multiple projects in parallel while managing constantly changing deadlines and priorities

        • Ability to document work and effectively prioritize documentation

        What will be nice to have?

        • Past experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial services industry (e.g., retail banking, credit card, property and casualty insurance)

        Unique Requirements

        The candidate selected for this role is required to have special clearance from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (http://iss-ssi.pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca/msi-ism/ch2-prt1-eng.html) ​

        What\'s in it for you?

        • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

        • 15 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program

        • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

        • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

        • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

        • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

        • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

        Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

        Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

        At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

        Salary Range:

        55,500/55 500 - 91,600/91 600

        Job Category:

        Advanced Analytics

        Posting End Date:

        12/08/2021
      Apply
          Posted 11 Days Ago
            Full time
              JR00045767

            About Us

              • PASSION.

                We\'re committed to making life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Our passion and purpose have fuelled us for more than 150 years. We\'re there for our Clients in the moments that matter most. We create opportunities to make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities  around the world.

                PEOPLE.

                We believe in harnessing your intellectual power and developing the best, brightest and most passionate people to serve our Clients.

                Diversity is our strength. We support an inclusive environment where you\'re a leader, collaborator, innovator and trusted partner.

                EMPLOYER OF CHOICE.

                We\'re consistently recognized as a top employer. We offer competitive pay, a flexible and progressive benefits programs, total rewards, agile work environments and more.

                Year after year, we\'re named as one of the world\'s most sustainable organizations. We invest in preventing diabetes on a global scale and lead community-based programs to improve the lives of individuals and families where we all live and work.

                RECENT AWARDS:

                Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work in Canada 2021

item.title: Senior Data Analyst
item.description:
• Senior Data Analyst

      Toronto, Ontario
        Waterloo, Ontario
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        Role Summary:

        Bring us your passion for agile marketing, digital, and data analytics, and we’ll put you to work on exciting initiatives that answer the challenge: "How can we better engage and nudge our clients in taking action to reach their financial and wellness goals?” Working with a dedicated team of energetic, forward-thinking innovators, you’ll stretch your imagination and sharpen your skills on the leading-edge projects that are keeping Sun Life Financial ahead of the curve. You want more than a job; you want a career with a company that encourages learning and personal growth. You want to be “one of the best.”

        The Digital Benefits Assistant (DBA) program is helping our clients achieve financial security and well-being by being an integrated part of their lives, proactively providing personalized, useful and actionable information. The program will become a leading digital client engagement platform that will fuel the velocity of the Sun Life Canadian business units. DBA will create a differentiated competitive advantage with our sponsors who will value the superior benefit offering and sponsor-employee relationship. It will be a magnet for Canadian digital talent by growing, developing and empowering team members.

        The Senior Data Analyst of the Digital Benefits Assistant (DBA) Program is accountable for analyzing the success of campaigns created and executed by their agile marketing team members. They are also responsible for understanding the target segment and uncovering new or previously untapped sales and service opportunities. The Agile team member embraces continuous change and the autonomy to make their own decisions without necessarily having prescriptive input from management. Team members are eager to gain cross-functional skills across different roles, so must be passionate about learning with a desire to expand both their business and technical knowledge.

        The Senior Data Analyst reports into the Manager, Data & Analytics and has a secondary reporting line into the Pod Lead.

        What will you do?

        • For each campaign, monitor and analyze key performance indicators as well as overall campaign results

        • Proactively identify challenges to campaign success and work with the agile team to find and implement solutions

        • Offer proactive feedback, strategic insights and ideas for campaign improvement

        • Partner with our Analytics team to uncover data driven insights to support the development of marketing strategies for segmented campaigns

        • Partner with our Analytics team and key stakeholders to support the ongoing segmentation/analysis of the member base to drive/inform targeted campaigns and initiatives in support of the key marketing strategies

        • Ensure the accurate and timely completion of all campaign reporting, including distribution and review with key stakeholders

        • Operationalize reporting and related processes to monitor and assess the success of the campaigns

        • Supporting the development of the marketing strategies through a robust understanding of the competitive landscape and industry

        • Providing regular campaign performance reviews to identify problems or opportunities


        What will you need to succeed?

        • Undergraduate in Business, Statistics or Computer Science (or equivalent university degree or college diploma)5+ years’ experience in a Data Analyst or Marketing Performance Analyst role

        • 3+ years\' experience working with SAS or similar tools

        • 2+ years experience with SQL

        • 2 +years’ experience working with Tableau or other visualization tools

        • Experience using analytical concepts and statistical techniques: hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendations for campaigns

        • Experience working with and deriving insight from large data sets

        • Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to break down high-level data into easily communicated information

        • Financial or Insurance services product experience and knowledge preferred

        • Ability to stay organized under conditions of multiple tasks and tight deadlines

        Unique Requirements

        • Must be able to attain Canadian Reliability Security Clearance (administered by submitting fingerprints to the RCMP, who then conduct min. 5 year history checks)

        What’s in it for you?

        • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

        • 20 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program

        • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

        • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

        • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

        • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

        • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

        Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

        Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

        At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

        67,400/67 400 - 110,100/110 100

        Job Category:

        Advanced Analytics

        22/08/2021

We\'re there for our Clients in the moments that matter most. We create opportunities to make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities  around the world.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist (Client Acquisition)
item.description:
• Senior Data Scientist (Client Acquisition)

      Toronto, Ontario
        Waterloo, Ontario
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        Role Summary

        Analytics & Insights is a multi-disciplinary center of excellence comprised of savvy and intellectually curious professionals who are on a mission to transform how we apply data and analytics to support Sun Life becoming client-centric.

        An integral part of the Analytics & Insights organization, the Data Science team works closely with various lines of business to build a recommendation system by leveraging big data and AI/Machine Learning algorithms!

        Flexibility and an entrepreneurial mindset are critical in this role, as part of your responsibility will be to build quick PoCs in an imperfect way to perfectly test & validate ideas.

        What will you need to succeed?

        • Minimum of master\'s degree in Statistics, Software Engineering, Mathematics, Econometrics, Physic or equivalent. PhD degree preferred.

        • Programming experience Python or R (3+ years)

        • Go-getter with agile mind set

        • Demonstrated data transformation & manipulation experience.

        • Deep understanding of deep learning and unsupervised models

        • Thirst for learning new methodologies and models

        • Detail oriented but do not get lost there!

        • Working experience in:

          • Agile framework

          • Big data platforms

          • Keras and Tensor Flow

          • AWS services including SageMaker

          • Structured vs. Unstructured data

        • Insurance and finance services industry preferred

        What will you do?

        • Design and develop AI/Machine Learning models for business operations: With access to enormous open source, third party and Sunlife data, you would be connecting different data sets and testing different AI algorithms (e.g. Reinforcement Learning, Collaborative Filtering, Long Short-Term Memory) to examine their business value. Once the value is proven, the model needs to be deployed and monitored in our production environment

        • Research new algorithms, document them, and share your findings with the team:  Data science is a fast-evolving field, every day there is a new algorithm out there that we can use and/or monitor them for future use.

        • Formally apply statistical/scientific rigour to the problems at hand: As much as we like our gut feelings but for a business to succeed, we need to make sure our solutions are scientifically correct.

        • Share what you see in the data as a story: Data on its own can be a bit dull, so we need to make it colorful by connecting the dots and telling a compelling story.

        • Analyze data to support model development and to identify potential areas for improvement: Data analysis could be about existing challenges, but it may also help identify areas for improvement and bring them to surface to get resolved – We need both!

        • Work with the team to document data models, architecture, algorithms: we work in an Agile environment, but it is not equivalent to NO documentation.

        What’s in it for you?

        • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

        • 20 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program

        • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

        • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

        • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

        • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

        • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

        Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

        Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

        At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

item.title: Delivery Manager, Data Science
item.description:
• Delivery Manager, Data Science

      North York, Ontario
        Toronto, Ontario
          Waterloo, Ontario
        Apply

        • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

          Job Description:

          Role Summary

          This role will be a member of the Data & Analytics team and will be accountable to initiate, plan, mobilize project teams, and govern them through to execution. She/he is accountable to remove barriers and facilitate solutions to address business partner\'s needs.  The successful candidate is expected to have a passion for data analytics and data science solutions and will need to be able to pick up and understand a wide range of analytics tools and solutions.

          What will you do?

          • Owns end-to-end solution delivery.  Accountable for project intake, estimation and resource planning to ensure projects are delivered on time, on budget and with required quality.

          • Work closely with the Architect and the Delivery Director during the concept phase of project to define project delivery approach, methodology.

          • Accountable for the technical leadership from project initiation to implementation. Ensures that a sound and future proof architecture is planned and its implementation meets the technical quality standards.

          • Ensures that appropriate organization, governance, decision making, and delivery structures are in place to drive outcomes articulated in the business case, CBA, business requirements, and program/project charter.

          • Ensures that standards and best practice for project and program management processes are applied to plan, and execute initiatives with high complexity and risk.

          • Contribute ideas for best practice improvements, process improvement, and innovative solutions. Become a member of the Data & Analytics thought leadership team, recommending solutions and products to our business partners aligned to the D&A strategy and roadmap.

          • Engage with executive level stakeholders to educate them on new concepts such as big data, analytics, and data science tools to helping to drive awareness across the organization.

          • Establish project structure and reporting relationships, ensure that everybody understands the project goals and his/her role and responsibilities, encourage good working relationships among all project team members, motivate and resolve conflicts between individual team members.

          What you will need to succeed?

          • University level degree in computer science, data science or related technology degree/diploma. Equivalent experience is also acceptable.

          • 4+ years of experience as delivery manager in data-related projects or equivalent experience.

          • 2+ years of experience executing projects following the data science life cycle.

          • Ideally 2+ years of experience with SQL, Tableau and Python for data analysis, or strong understanding of these tools and how they fit within a data science project.

          • Knowledge of ETL and data modelling.

          • Understanding of predictive analytics/machine learning concepts.

          • Have an end-to-end vision when proposing data solutions from ideation and prototyping up to productionisation.

          • Ability to describe and put into action complex concepts.

          • Ability to lead small, medium and large project teams.

          • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

          • Strong business acumen with strong ability to solve business problems through data driven methodologies.

          • Ability to liaison between different business units and tech teams in order to plan and deliver complex projects with multiple moving pieces.

          • Ability to facilitate business prioritization and decisions.

          • Passion for data and analytics as a career and a willingness to constantly educate herself/himself to stay relevant and keep track of trends in the data space.

          What will be nice to have?

          • Experience working in banking, insurance or healthcare industries

          • Knowledge of big data, analytics and Hadoop concepts

          • Knowledge of cloud concepts and main cloud services offered by open cloud providers (ideally AWS).

          • Experience working in Lean / Agile / Scrum methodologies for enterprise IT delivery.

          What’s in it for you?

          • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

          • 20 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program

          • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

          • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

          • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

          • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

          • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

          The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

item.description:
• Information Technology Analyst - Data and BI Technologies

      North York, Ontario
        Waterloo, Ontario
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        The Data and Analytics team is looking for a skilled Information Technology Analyst to support business intelligence software infrastructure and clients for Sun Life worldwide. You will be responsible for the availability, performance, stability and recoverability of the BI technologies and applications supported by the Data and Business Intelligence Technologies team as well as fulfilling client requests. You will also be working on the design and implement new Business Intelligence technology infrastructures and procedures.

        What you will do:

        • Provide product and environment support and administration for business intelligence software environments - SAP Business Objects, Microsoft Power BI, Qlikview, Tableau   
        • Manage intake and fill user requests – examples are application and user set up and administration, code promotion requests, software consulting and problem support
        • Lead/participate in new software and software upgrade assessment and implementation projects
        • Lead/participate in design and implementation of software product deployment infrastructure
        • Lead/participate in design, development, testing, implementation and support system management and support processes and procedures
        • Lead/participate in technical solution design and implementation using the BI software supported by the team
        • Lead/participate in Sun Life Disaster Recovery tests
        • Keep abreast of technology landscape and industry trends pertaining to business intelligence
        • Provide timely updates to Manager, co-workers, project managers and business users
        • Ensure business intelligence environments supported by the Data and Business Intelligence Technologies team are secured and well supported, as well as meeting predetermined service level.
        • Ensure all client requests, infrastructure support requests are completed on time with good client satisfaction
        • Ensure project deliverables are of good quality and delivered on time within budget 
        • Ensure departmental standards, guidelines and policies are followed.

        What you will need to succeed:

        • + 3 years of working experience on one of the following software products and infrastructures:
          • SAP Business Objects suite of software
          • Microsoft Power BI
          • Tableau
          • Qliview
        • 3 years of experience with SAP Business Object Universes, Crystal and WEBI reporting
        • 2 years of experience with Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, Qlikview
        • 2 years of experience with security protocols such as LDAP, Keberos, and Windows Active Directory
        • 1 year of experience with network and data connectivity, including connectivity to big data infrastructure 
        • 3 years of experience with with Linux, Windows server OS and utilities
        • 1 year of experience with with Cloud infrastructures AWS and Azure
        • 3 years of experience with with SQL and relational databases running on Windows, Unix, Linux, and mainframe

        Assets

        • Knowledge of other business intelligence and data integration software such as IBM InfoSphere, SAS
        • Knowledge of Big Data systems and related protocols and services
        • Knowledge of system development life cycle and agile development methodologies
        • Experience with application development tools such as java and Microsoft .net
        • Financial and Insurance business experience

        Notes/Unique Requirements

        Production support and after-hours on-call on rotation

        Availability to work on after working hours scheduled work as required, examples are project implementation, server patching and Disaster Recovery Test

        Canadian Federal Government Reliability Clearance required

item.title: Senior Analytics Consultant
item.description:
• Senior Analytics Consultant

      Toronto, Ontario
    Apply

    • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

      Job Description:

      In this position, you will be a key member of the Group Retirement Services (GRS) Finance team; supporting the development of Client metrics reporting and accompanying financial measures.  Collaborating with peers and leaders across the Canadian business unit data centres, you will be responsible to design, create and evolve our data analytics platform to accelerate the development of reporting, insights and strategic initiatives for drivers of cash flows, churn, revenue generation and profitability.  Successful candidates will possess more than 5 years of practical experience developing insightful reports/dashboards, drawing actionable recommendations from insights and demonstrate an ability to communicate effectively with senior leaders and other stakeholders. The role requires creative problem-solving ability, excellent communication and presentation skills, a willingness to try new techniques, and the ability to handle several diverse and concurrent projects.

      This role reports to the Director, Business Analytics.

      What will you do?

      Analytics & Business Insights

      • Support the development of Client metrics reporting processes, benchmarking and visualization to provide insights to stakeholders, by leveraging multiple data source systems and integration layers, using a variety of tools and programming languages

      • Act as a subject matter expert or technical team lead on projects, ask questions and develop hypotheses, apply descriptive statistics, diagnostic techniques to answer business questions

      • Apply financial business knowledge to improve the economics of key drivers in the highest value areas

      • Ability to draw out business insights from analytical output and work with team leads to put together effective presentations of actionable insights and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders

      • Maintain standards for analysis and reporting at all levels including best practice data visualization techniques

      Data Management & Integrity

      • Provide expert guidance to design, develop, maintain and continuously improve various SAS databases to enable accurate, reliable and timely data to support analytics, modeling, reporting, visualization and dashboards/KPI’s

      • Ensure all processes preserve data integrity by managing the alignment of data availability and integration processes

      • Data discovery - Liaison with IT and other analytics teams to scope new data sources, understanding and leveraging of current data sources for revenue generation, member and Client insights

      • Comply fully with all privacy, confidentiality, do not contact, SLF Code of Business Conduct, data security, and other requirements related to customer data

      What will you need to succeed?

      • Minimum of Bachelor degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent experience.  MBA or post-grad degree in data analytics an asset

      • 5+ years demonstrated experience working with data, including transformation and manipulation, using a variety of data analysis methods

      • 5+ years intermediate to advanced knowledge in SQL, SAS

      • Advanced user of Excel with extensive financial modeling experience

      • 2+ years experience using Tableau

      • Must be able to effectively communicate (written and verbal) complex results to a business audience not familiar with complex data and analytics   

      • Ability to automate/develop complex reports &/or produce dashboards & scorecards & able to propose solutions to data issues

      • Ability to build partnerships and develop relationships with a variety of stakeholders

      • Good working knowledge of basic data warehousing concepts

      • Good working knowledge of presentation software such as PowerPoint

      • Proven ability to work well independently, but also function in a team environment, with frequent contact with people at all levels of the SLF Canada organization

      • Proven balance of analytical and creative problem-solving skills

      • Able to think with agility in meeting business partners\' demanding deadlines

      • Ability to move with minimum effort from detailed diagnostic thinking to higher level, opportunity-oriented thinking and to integrate the best from both into contributions and deliverables

      What will be nice to have?

      • Knowledge of the DC recordkeeping business

      • Experience with AWS and Spark

      • Experience with analysis of unstructured data

      • Experience gathering and integrating external data with internal data

      Unique Requirements

      Must be able to obtain Reliability Status through the Government of Canada before a start date can be confirmed (includes a background check with fingerprinting by the RCMP).

      To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (http://iss-ssi.pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca/msi-ism/ch2-prt1-eng.html) ​

       What\'s in it for you?

      • 20 vacation days per year

      • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

      • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

      • A ‘dress for the day’ dress code, where you dictate how you dress based on your day

      The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

      Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

      Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

      At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

      We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

      Advanced Analytics

        Toronto, Ontario
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self.         Job Description:

        Acting as a technical expert in network logical connection, configuration and test data management, the incumbent will provide data and environment services for test environments to all Sun Life Financial Business Units.

        What will you do?

        • Explore ways to enhance data quality and reliability

        • Recommend and support data management tools and processes to support system integrated data mining, subsetting and classification

        • Design, implement, and support data management processes to support DevOps CI/CD methodology

        • Define and document test environment configuration and test data requirements for all testing activities

        • Work with the Test Architect to maintain a data refresh and test environment strategy

        • Manage, document, and communicate software delivery schedule of the data management tools

        • Manage issues related to test environment, test data and configuration

        • Coordinate and track all system test data loads, refreshes, backups and baselines as required

        • Implement improvements to current configuration and procedures and develop models of possible future configurations and automation considerations

        • Analyze and present progress reports on problem resolution to management

        • Design and review processes for data de-identification / masking

        • Participate in the review of any architecturally significant initiatives

        • Interact with both business areas and developers to identify test environment and test data requirements

        • Work with SQA and Developers to recommend implementation of test environments to support project delivery

        • Perform feasibility studies to analyze cost/benefit trade-off of environment solutions and automation.

        • Coordinate availability and provisioning of environments and configurations required for SQA, regression and performance testing and training purposes

        • Provide education and dissemination of good test data and environment management practices for Sun Life Financial

        What do you need to succeed?

        • Strong knowledge of Database technologies for both distributed and mainframe environments

        • Development experience with JCL, SQL, PL/I, Cobol, C

        • Knowledge of data de-identification/masking approaches and tools to remove private data from test environments

        • Knowledge of hardware, systems software and utilities, network communications, database technology, computer operations, and virtual technologies

    Apply

      Job Description:

      The Data Centre Analyst will be responsible for participating in IT hardware life-cycle management process, as required.  The resource will be involved in collection (based on IT owner input), documenting (based on IT owner input), contacting and scheduling of vendor pickup and co-ordination of onsite resource escorts. This Data Centre Analyst role will support the Data Centre Operations Cable Management and Data Centre Services technicians in final executions in the life-cycle of IT hardware.

      This role calls for some knowledge of IT towers and some experience of operational best practices.

      *** Must be able to obtain Reliability Status through the Government of Canada before a start date can be confirmed (includes a background check with fingerprinting by the RCMP). ***

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        Role Summary

        Do you have a passion for data? Do you enjoy influencing business decisions that impact our employees, clients and financial outcome? If you are analytical, curious, love solving complex business problems, we need you to join our high performing team to deliver exceptional value through analytics and insights that will drive the right actions for the business

        The Global Security Analytics team is looking for a Senior Data Scientist that will help us improve monitoring and control of advanced cyber threats by extracting insights hidden in vast amounts of network and security log data.

        Your primary focus will be building machine learning models, applying data mining techniques, performing statistical analysis and developing actionable reports with data visualizations. Your success in this role will be achieved by identifying previously undiscovered intrusions or by improving the organization’s security posture or the measurement thereof. The goal is to create new strategic and tactical value from security-relevant data through the dedicated exploration, analysis and investigation of that data using cutting-edge analytic technologies and techniques.

        What will you need?

        • Perform large-scale data analysis and applying effective statistical methods and machine learning models for improving Cybersecurity detection at Sun Life.

        • Design and develop AI/Machine Learning models for business operations

        • Design, develop, test, and deploy workloads on AWS SageMaker, applying models and algorithms to mine the stores of big data.

        • Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis.

        • Developing complex SQL queries across multiple data sources to support analysis and optimizing workloads to reduce query runtimes.

        • Accurately prepare and promptly complete all required supporting documentation for assigned projects/tasks (i.e., reports, models, change requests, presentations, tables, files, etc).

        • Present information using data visualization techniques for internal business partners.

        What you need to succeed?

        • BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field; graduate degree in Data Science or other quantitative field is preferred.

        • 5+ years experience in using Python/R and SQL (Hadoop, Microsoft SQL Server, SAS, Oracle, etc.) to analyze data and gather valuable insights.

        • 2 + years experience developing and building ML models including Predictive Modelling, Data Science application development.

        • Minimum of 1 year experience with Amazon Web Services including Athena, Redshift, Lambda and SageMaker.

        • Thorough knowledge and demonstrated experience in data management best practices (importing, cleaning, transforming, validating, quality and modeling data)

        • Conceptual understanding of the following topics:

          • Machine Learning (ML) techniques, and comprehension of existing algorithms and ML lifecycle components.

          • Database theory, ETL/data pipeline design and data modelling.

        • Solid communication skills – have the ability to explain complexity of data and analytical models to a non-data audience and explain the complexity of analytics to the business, IT and governance audience

        • Adaptable - maintains effectiveness while managing competing demands, able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events

        Unique Requirements

        The candidate selected for this role is required to have special clearance from the RoyalCanadian Mounted Police. To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (http://iss-ssi.pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca/msi-ism/ch2-prt1-eng.html) ​. Canadian Reliability Security Clearance is administered by submitting fingerprints to the RCMP, who then conduct min. 5 year history checks)

        What will be nice to have?

        • Experience with Data Visualization and Reporting tools (Tableau Desktop, Power BI, AWS Quicksight) is nice to have

        What’s in it for you?

        • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

        • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

        • An environment of continuous learning and improvement

        • Flexible hours and periodic work from home options

        • The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

        Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

        Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

        At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

item.title: AVP, Data Protection and Security Analytics
item.description:
• AVP, Data Protection and Security Analytics

      Waterloo, Ontario
        Toronto, Ontario
          North York, Ontario
        Apply

        • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

          Job Description:

          Applicants must have lived continuously in Canada for 5 years or more to be eligible for Reliability Status Clearance. No exceptions please.

          This position reports directly to the Vice President and Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) and has direct oversight of Data Protection and Intelligent Security Analytics for AI and Data Science driven cybersecurity threat prediction and identification.

          The AVP, Data Protection and Security Analytics will be responsible for defining and aligning strategies for data protection and intelligent security threat analytics to ensure that exposures to data and cybersecurity threats are identified and managed at an acceptable level. The position is an integral part in the development and implementation of data protection and security threat intelligence analytics programs across the enterprise. In this role you will regularly act as a voice of Information Security to clients and management, building cyber security confidence in support of business development and governance processes.

          Job Description

          • Develop and manage the data protection and intelligent cybersecurity threat analytics (AI) strategy, framework and approach, globally.
          • Develop strategies and action plans to drive data protection and intelligent threat analytics maturity improvement.
          • Partner with Architecture and Engineering teams to develop data protection risk mitigation and intelligent cybersecurity threat analytics strategies, solutions, and recommendations to reduce components, systems, or enterprise security risk.
          • Provide briefings to leadership and advise them of critical issues that may affect enterprise data protection and cybersecurity threat objectives.
          • Integrate data protection security risk reporting and aggregate reporting into the Enterprise risk framework.
          • In conjunction with Legal, Privacy and Compliance, identify information management and protection laws and regulations and implement actions to ensure compliance.
          • Ensure a comprehensive understanding of existing requirements and ongoing monitoring of new requirements.
          • Identify global data protection security regulatory, legislative, and industry specific compliance requirements and applicability to each line of business.
          • Support the Vice President and CISO in establishing annual and long-term goals for data protection and intelligent cybersecurity threat analytics.

          Qualifications, Experience, Skills and Attributes

          • Minimum of 15 years work experience in IT and CyberSecurity with direct responsibility for technologies in scope, including at least 10 years previous experience in a management role.
          • Experience working in an IT and CyberSecurity organization with global operations.
          • Experience creating and rolling out an enterprise wide global Data Protection strategy and program.
          • Experience with AI and Data Science driven intelligent cyberthreat analytics is an asset.
          • Experience working in a shared services IT model desirable.
          • Bachelor degree in Computer Science/Engineering/Information Security/Business preferred or equivalent combination of education and/or relevant experience.
          • Extensive experience in enterprise security program development and implementation, enterprise security governance, and managing security staff.
          • Understanding of threat driven methodologies, Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), threat modeling and cyber attack trees.
          • Ability to evaluate risks to the company and articulate issues, develop consensus, raise awareness, and provide and implement solutions.
          • Knowledge of common information technology and security management frameworks such as ISO/IEC 27001, ITIL, COBIT, and NIST.
          • Knowledge and understanding of relevant legal, regulatory and privacy requirements.
          • Strong program management experience.
          • Ability to work collaboratively and effectively with a cross-section of the Enterprise Services team and business organizations to implement information security standards and initiatives.
          • Ability to clearly present complex technical concepts and techniques to others.
          • Excellent written and spoken communication skills.
          • Comfortable and effective in building partnerships with organizational leaders and influencing senior management.
          • Ability to manage multiple projects with changing/shifting/dynamic priorities.

          What’s in it for you?

          • Named 2021 “Best Places to Work” by Glassdoor
          • Work and professional development that is united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives
          • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
          • Be part of our continuous improvement journey in developing the next greatest digital enterprise experience.
          • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
          • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
          • A common sense dress code, where you decide how you dress based on your day
          • The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential
          • Flex hours and work from home options.

We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

item.title: Senior Data Engineer
item.description:
You will be responsible for designing and implementing data models and ETL pipelines to meet product requirements, design of product functions, troubleshooting and resolving product defects, unit and integration testing. Active interaction with internal customers, other developers, Quality Assurance, Business System Analysts is an integral part of the role.

About the Role:

In the role of Sr. Data Engineer you will:

Participate in project/work planning sessions:

  • To analyze and understand requirements to the level of being able to contribute to their creation, in collaboration with capability/product and/or business owners.

  • Work in a hands-on data engineering role in a team-based cross-functional environment.

Develop and deliver:

  • Integrate applications per specification and translate technical requirements into application code and modules

  • Approach development work with a DevOps and continuous integration mindset.

  • Ensure consistency with cloud architectural guiding principles for assigned projects

  • Develop prototype or "proof of concept" implementations of projects where the technical solution is unknown or unproven

  • Proactive in raising problems, identifying solutions and giving/receiving feedback

  • Assist in identifying and correcting software performance bottlenecks

Be collaborative: Work in a highly collaborative and dynamic agile team environment with multiple levels of technology staff across various geographical locations

Coach and mentor: Providing technical expertise and peer code reviews to other team members and assist team leads and project managers in work break down and story planning

About You

You\'re a fit for Sr. Data Engineer if you have: 

  • Bachelor’s in computer science or equivalent work experience.

  • 7+ years of experience in application development with demonstrable, proven expertise in design and development of high volume, high velocity data ingestion, complex data transformation using traditional ETL technologies or modern data ingestion/processing technologies.

  • Minimum 4 years of experience working with relational databases like Oracle, Postgres or similar using SQL. Should have hands on experience in writing performant queries/procedures handling complex functionalities. Experience in NoSQL databases and dealing with unstructured data will be good to have.

  • Hands on experience in developing data warehousing and big data analytics applications using big data frameworks like Hadoop, Spark and/or Flink and leveraging services such as AWS EMR or Google DataProc.

  • Strong understanding of concepts of ETL, ELT and data modeling.

  • Hands-on experience in development of cloud native applications in Google Cloud.

  • Hands-on experience in BigQuery / Google DataProc.

  • Exposure to reporting via looker would be an advantage.

  • Professional Google Cloud certification would be good to have.

  • Preferred familiarity with SQL-on-Hadoop technologies such as Spark SQL, Hive, and/or Presto.

  • Minimum 2 year of strong experience in python.

  • Programming experience in languages such as Java, C# etc.

  • Experience in orchestration tools like Apache Airflow.

  • Experience in troubleshooting performance issues resulted from high volume data during processing from upstream & serving to the downstream applications.

  • Prefer experience working with Linux or Unix based environments.

  • Other skills required:

  • Proven strong analytical design, problem solving and trouble-shooting skills.

  • Strong understanding of Cloud computing Technologies and related emerging technology.

  • Highly accountable for meeting all commitments and deadlines.

  • Effective communication skills, both written and verbal for technical and non-technical audiences.

  • Must be able to work independently as well as collaboratively.

  • Drive for continuous process improvement.

What’s in it For You?

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development:

    • On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to leading-edge technology

    • Career growth - ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams

    • Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone

  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage that’s effective day one

  • Perks: Social events & activities, employee discount programs through corporate perks

  • Flexibility: We\'ve been named as one of Forbes, Best Companies for Work/Life Balance

  • Global Opportunities:  We have employees in over 90 countries, working across 3 different industries

  • Your wellbeing:  We offer a program that focuses on making our lives healthier

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. 

Accessibility 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

item.title: Data Governance Analyst
item.description:
The Data Governance Analyst role within the Commercial Data Office will be responsible for developing and implementing data standards, guaranteeing metadata is captured correctly, and creating methods for monitoring and reporting any data incidents. The Data Governance analyst will monitor applications to ensure they are complying to data governance procedures. They may also create and maintain common business glossaries for data and the tools or methods that support data standards for an organization.

About the Role:

  • Perform data profiling and database structure/model research in order to understand relevant data elements along with their definitions and use.
  • Participate in data governance policy and standard creation, management, and analyzing potential impacts of policy choices under consideration
  • Document and maintain data standards, partnering with functional and business data owners to map existing commercial data structures, usage, and common definitions
  • Design, build, and execute efficient and accurate control structures to assess data quality and compliance to data governance policy
  • Provide consultative support for commercial data clients, advising on policies, standards, and guidelines
  • Support the Data Governance team in establishing Working groups, as needed to drive consistency and decisioning
  • Support the Data Governance team in establishing and operating the company’s critical data forums (data councils, working groups, etc.)
  • Drive adoption of the company’s data governance focused policies

About You:

  • Bachelor’s degree required with 3+ years of experience
  • You are passionate about the benefits of accurate and actionable data, you drive consistency and enjoy partnering with others to accomplish the task
  • You are a solutions-oriented critical thinker
  • You have technical knowledge and experience in data management, data governance, and/or data quality
  • Comfortable leading team meetings and possess strong influencing and networking skills
  • You demonstrate the ability to translate business issues and requirements into actionable plans, and to deliver against those plans
  • You have the exceptional ability to make timely and effective decisions to meet fluid deadlines
  • You have the capability to work autonomously and make independent decisions to meet deliverables with minimal oversight
  • You are passionate about continuous improvement with a strong desire to continue learning in order to stay relevant to business changes and industry trends
  • You can effectively handle and maintain confidential information
  • You have at a minimum basic proficiency in SQL with a thorough understanding of data and systems\' infrastructures
  • Knowledge/experience in Alteryx preferred
  • Expert level Excel user
  • Proficient in BI tools such as Tableau

What\'s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development: On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to leading-edge technology, LinkedIn learning
  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage that\'s effective day one
  • Perks: Social events & activities, employee discount programs through corporate perks, 16 hours of paid volunteer time off yearly

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Accessibility 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. item.title: Data Architect
item.description:
We are responsible for designing and delivering core technology platforms that provide tools for editorially enhancing and delivering content to our customers.  We are looking for a motivated and innovative Data Architect.  In this role, you will work across geographical boundaries with all levels of software engineers, technical management, and business partners.  You will set the data architectural direction for projects delivering new and re-engineered functionality.  The ideal candidate will have experience in making technology decisions on large, enterprise-scale software development programs. The candidate will also have extensive skills in the areas of design, development, mentoring and directing co-workers. 

About the Role 

In this opportunity as a Data Architect, you will: 

Design and deliver:

  • Creates the information architecture vision and strategy for the assets under the purview of the group
  • Defines the group’s governance and standards to deliver a cohesive information architecture for the organization
  • Delivers innovative and elegant information solutions that drive growth, and leverage to ensure faster time-to-market
  • Translates user requirements and business use cases to conceptual, logical, and physical data models and workflow processes.
  • Translates a business glossary into logical and physical data models, and coach/ supports data modelers and engineers in their development/ testing/ implementation effort.
  • Identify appropriate sources for external teams’ (R&D, Product Management, Editorial, Technology and other Content organizations) data needs, create the necessary data mapping and transformation rules, with a focus on business objectives and processes.
  • Ensures solutions meet the compliance and security needs of TR

Be Collaborative:

  • Communicates designs and solutions through formal and informal means to business unit executives, technology management, peers and development staff, and other colleagues

Coach and mentor:

  • Mentor junior staff in Data Modeling and other Information Architecture activities

Be curious and innovative:

  • Assists in the technology decisions for data strategy, workflow processes, and infrastructure for a wide range of system solutions for the Thomson Reuters Editorial and Content Operations teams.

About You 

You\'re a fit for the role of Data Architect if you have:  

  • 5+ years’ experience as a Data Modeler/ Data Architect, in an integrated business and IT collaborative environment.
  • Combination of strategic thinking and detail orientation.
  • Demonstrated ability to balance being inquisitive, curious, continuously learning, and realistic vs. visionary, technology savvy, and business orientation.
  • Excellent critical thinking, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to operate across organizational boundaries and to influence all stakeholders, (e.g., technology staff, business partners, and vendors) having an impact on the community.
  • Expert-level proficiency in data modeling for relational, dimensional, and big data platforms. Experience with a broad range of data schemas (e.g., ontologies, taxonomies, DTDs etc.), as well as strong SQL skills
  • Additional broad experience in enterprise use of the following technologies: Messaging Technologies (e.g., IBM MQ, Kafka), Big Data (Hadoop, HDFS, HBase, Spark), CSS, XML (DOM, SAX), DHTML/ XHTML/ HTML5, Web Services, Cognitive Computing, Classification, Machine Learning, NLP, NLG, Public Cloud (AWS & MS Azure), & MS Teams Foundation Server/Azure DevOps
  • Strong interpersonal skills supported by exceptional written and oral communication skills: strong hands-on documentation experience and collaboration skills working across geographical sites.
  • Experience with Agile software design methodologies and tools.

What’s in it For You?

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development:
    • On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to leading-edge technology

item.title: Associate Architect - Data Engineering
item.description:
Associate Architect

As a technologist at Thomson Reuters, you will help shape the global knowledge economy. Our technology ensures that professionals around the world have the answers they need. You will work with the brightest thinkers on diverse projects, creating next-generation solutions that deliver powerful results. As the world’s top provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career. Bring your passion for innovation, and together we’ll make a difference.


About the Role 

In this role you will:

  • Be a Technical Leader – provide thought leadership and guidance in setting the architecture vision and direction for an extendible and maintainable set of editorial system and publishing capabilities. Work with technology teams and beyond to realize their implementation
  • Be a Team Player – ability to work in a collaborative and inclusive team-oriented environment, partner with cross functional and remote teams, draw out strong design ideas from diverse teams and high performing engineers, and translate requirements into actionable architecture
  • Be an Effective Communicator – ability to concisely and completely articulate complex technical issues; ability to target your audience, actively listen, and value diverse ideas
  • Be an Agile Person – with a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines
  • Be Curious & Innovative – ability to question the status quo.  Continuously update yourself with industry trends, next generation technology, and software development best practices. 

About You

  • Experience in software design, methodologies (especially Agile), and tools
  • Broad experience in enterprise-class system, full-stack, design and development including use of the following technologies: Java, Front-End Technologies (e.g., JavaScript, jQuery, Angular), XML (DOM, SAX), DHTML/XHTML/HTML5, CSS, Database and SQL (e.g., Oracle, SQL Server), as well as NoSQL, Messaging Technologies (e.g., IBM MQ, Kafka), APIs (e.g., REST, SOAP), Web Services (e.g, Tomcat), MS ADO, Eclipse, Ant, Maven, Junit
  • Must be an excellent communicator when speaking, writing, and in diagramming

  • Advanced analytical skills with the ability to synthesize business requirements with technology capabilities to produce coherent technical designs
  • Demonstrated ability to quickly learn and analyze new technologies
  • Have 5+years relevant experience in large distributed systems, including 1+ years architecture/ design experience.
  • You may also have:
    • Cloud experience (AWS or Azure)
    • Experience in Cognitive Computing (e.g, Machine Learning, NLP, Classification, Clustering)
    • Architecting API-first solutions
    • Experience in processing large volumes of data
    • System load and scale testing

  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage that’s effective day one

item.title: VP, Data Lake Platform
item.description:
The strategic ambition of the newly created Data & Analytics (D&A) function is to build, embed and mature a data-driven culture across the entire company resulting in a world-class Data & Analytics company.

Position Description:
The VP, Data Lake Platform is responsible for building, operating and evolving a single data lake in the cloud for Thomson Reuters.  They will engage with analytics teams across the company to ensure feature/function requirements are understood and prioritized to drive maximum value for customers and colleagues.  This leader will build a strong data engineering capability within TR and deliver DIY/Self-Serve capabilities to all certified analytics team members.

Responsibilities:

  • Work collaboratively with all parts of TR to drive a data-driven culture
  • Design, implement, operate and evolve the TR Data Lake including:
    • Real-time, Near Real Time and Batch processing
    • Automated ingestion & data lineage controls
    • DIY/Self-service capabilities for certified lake consumers (e.g. DIY data pipelines, Data Publishing)
    • Automated data profiling and data quality measurement
    • Structured, Unstructured and Semi-structured data sources
  • Design and implement strong security and privacy enhancing technologies & methods.
  • Actively track and report progress to senior stakeholders on data lake progress and value enablement
  • Responsible for setting the strategic direction and executing the roadmap for TR Data Lake
  • Implement training and certification programs for Data Lake capabilities (pipelines, ingestion, conformance, etc)
  • Build a strong data engineering practice across TR
  • Ensure D&A is a diverse and inclusive organisation.
  • Meet Financial Plan targets; drive lake productivity improvements (e.g. cost/unit reductions)

This role will partner across the TR Data & Analytics organization to:

  • Implement data quality measurement, metadata tagging and lineage/provenance practices (with the D&A Data Management Shared Services team)
  • Automation of Data Stewardship and Model Governance function (with Data Governance and Advanced Analytics Platform teams)
  • Deliver on Change Program capabilities

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business, library sciences or equivalent experience
  • A minimum of 10 years of experience in data warehouse or data lake platform construction and operations
  • Prior experience working in a large, geographically dispersed organization.
  • Experience leading and developing highly effective teams
  • 10+ years of software development or engineering and/or executive positions
  • Extensive experience creating and executing data platform strategy and related technical roadmaps 
  • Ability to understand, evaluate and decide among technical integration scenarios and architectural concepts 
  • Experience with Agile methodologies and understanding of modern web/SaaS technologies and systems 
  • Experience presenting strategy and operational updates to senior executives 

Desired Qualifications:

  • Experience in driving large-scale change across a global organization
  • Strong organization, analytical and problem-solving skills with an end-user focus
  • Ability to prioritize, self-initiate, and create momentum, even with partial guidance or information
  • Exceptionally strong verbal and written communication skills with ability to effectively communicate updates and desired outcomes in a succinct manner
